db:abstract.db:para: The QJsonValue class encapsulates a value in JSON.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.0.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:listitem.db:para: QJsonValue is part of JSON Support in QtImplicitly Shared Classes

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A value in JSON can be one of 6 basic types:
JSON is a format to store structured data. It has 6 basic data types:
A value can represent any of the above data types. In addition, QJsonValue has one special flag to represent undefined values. This can be queried with isUndefined().

The type of the value can be queried with type() or accessors like isBool(), isString(), and so on. Likewise, the value can be converted to the type stored in it using the toBool(), toString() and so on.

Values are strictly typed internally and contrary to QVariant will not attempt to do any implicit type conversions. This implies that converting to a type that is not stored in the value will return a default constructed return value.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValueRef
db:section.db:para: QJsonValueRef is a helper class for QJsonArray and QJsonObject. When you get an object of type QJsonValueRef, you can use it as if it were a reference to a QJsonValue. If you assign to it, the assignment will apply to the element in the QJsonArray or QJsonObject from which you got the reference.
The following methods return QJsonValueRef:

db:section.db:title: enum QJsonValue::Type
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the type of the JSON value.

db:td.db:para: A boolean value. Use toBool() to convert to a bool.
A double. Use toDouble() to convert to a double.
A string. Use toString() to convert to a QString.
An array. Use toArray() to convert to a QJsonArray.
An object. Use toObject() to convert to a QJsonObject.
The value is undefined. This is usually returned as an error condition, when trying to read an out of bounds value in an array or a non existent key in an object.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue::QJsonValue(QJsonValue::Type type = Null)
db:section.db:para: Creates a QJsonValue of type type.
The default is to create a Null value.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue::QJsonValue(QLatin1String s)
db:section.db:para: Creates a value of type String, with value s.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue::QJsonValue(bool b)
db:section.db:para: Creates a value of type Bool, with value b.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue::QJsonValue(const QJsonArray &a)
db:section.db:para: Creates a value of type Array, with value a.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue::QJsonValue(const QJsonObject &o)
db:section.db:para: Creates a value of type Object, with value o.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue::QJsonValue(const QString &s)
db:section.db:para: Creates a value of type String, with value s.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.3] QJsonValue::QJsonValue(const char *s)
db:section.db:para: Creates a value of type String with value s, assuming UTF-8 encoding of the input.
You can disable this constructor by defining QT_NO_CAST_FROM_ASCII when you compile your applications.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue::QJsonValue(double n)
db:section.db:para: Creates a value of type Double, with value n.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue::QJsonValue(int n)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Creates a value of type Double, with value n.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue::QJsonValue(qint64 n)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

Creates a value of type Double, with value n. NOTE: the integer limits for IEEE 754 double precision data is 2^53 (-9007199254740992 to +9007199254740992). If you pass in values outside this range expect a loss of precision to occur.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue::QJsonValue(const QJsonValue &other)
db:section.db:para: Creates a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QJsonValue::~QJsonValue()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the value.

db:section.db:title: [static] QJsonValue QJsonValue::fromVariant(const QVariant &variant)
db:section.db:para: Converts variant to a QJsonValue and returns it.
The conversion will convert QVariant types as follows:
For all other QVariant types a conversion to a QString will be attempted. If the returned string is empty, a Null QJsonValue will be stored, otherwise a String value using the returned QString.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonValue::isArray() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the value contains an array.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonValue::isBool() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the value contains a boolean.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonValue::isDouble() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the value contains a double.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonValue::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the value is null.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonValue::isObject() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the value contains an object.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonValue::isString() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the value contains a string.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonValue::isUndefined() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the value is undefined. This can happen in certain error cases as e.g. accessing a non existing key in a QJsonObject.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray QJsonValue::toArray(const QJsonArray &defaultValue) const
db:section.db:para: Converts the value to an array and returns it.
If type() is not Array, the defaultValue will be returned.

db:section.db:title: QJsonArray QJsonValue::toArray() const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Converts the value to an array and returns it.
If type() is not Array, a QJsonArray() will be returned.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonValue::toBool(bool defaultValue = false) const
db:section.db:para: Converts the value to a bool and returns it.
If type() is not bool, the defaultValue will be returned.

db:section.db:title: double QJsonValue::toDouble(double defaultValue = 0) const
db:section.db:para: Converts the value to a double and returns it.
If type() is not Double, the defaultValue will be returned.

db:section.db:title: int QJsonValue::toInt(int defaultValue = 0) const
db:section.db:para: Converts the value to an int and returns it.
If type() is not Double or the value is not a whole number, the defaultValue will be returned.

db:section.db:title: QJsonObject QJsonValue::toObject(const QJsonObject &defaultValue) const
db:section.db:para: Converts the value to an object and returns it.
If type() is not Object, the defaultValue will be returned.

db:section.db:title: QJsonObject QJsonValue::toObject() const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Converts the value to an object and returns it.
If type() is not Object, the QJsonObject() will be returned.

db:section.db:title: QString QJsonValue::toString() const
db:section.db:para: Converts the value to a QString and returns it.
If type() is not String, a null QString will be returned.

db:section.db:title: QString QJsonValue::toString(const QString &defaultValue) const
db:section.db:para: Converts the value to a QString and returns it.
If type() is not String, the defaultValue will be returned.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QJsonValue::toVariant() const
db:section.db:para: Converts the value to a QVariant().
The QJsonValue types will be converted as follows:

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue::Type QJsonValue::type() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the type of the value.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonValue::operator!=(const QJsonValue &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the value is not equal to other.

db:section.db:title: QJsonValue &QJsonValue::operator=(const QJsonValue &other)
db:section.db:para: Assigns the value stored in other to this object.

db:section.db:title: bool QJsonValue::operator==(const QJsonValue &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the value is equal to other.
